</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:15PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Item 7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations: (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has chosen accounting policies that it believes are appropriate to accurately and fairly report its operating results and financial position, and the Company applies those accounting policies in a consistent manner.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Significant Accounting Policies are summarized in Note 1 to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As a result of implementing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") 2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes (Topic 740): Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	reclassified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	its current deferred income tax liabilities as noncurrent deferred income tax liabilities retrospectively for all periods presented as of the year ended December 26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;See Note 1(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	x)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	included in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nnual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eport on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	orm 10-K for more information on the Company&#x2019;s accounting policy changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires that the Company makes estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses.&nbsp;&nbsp;These estimates and assumptions are based on historical and other factors believed to be reasonable under the circumstances.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company evaluates these estimates and assumptions on an ongoing basis and may retain outside consultants, lawyers and actuaries to assist in its evaluation.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company believes the following accounting policies are the most critical because they involve the most significant judgments and estimates used in preparation of its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inventories are valued at the lower of cost or market, using both the last-in, first-out (LIFO) and average cost methods.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s center store and pharmacy inventories are valued using LIFO and the Company&#x2019;s fresh inventories are valued using average cost.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company evaluates inventory shortages throughout the year based on actual physical counts in its facilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Allowances for inventory shortages are recorded based on the results of these counts and to provide for estimated shortages from the last physical count to the financial statement date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Property and Equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Property and equipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recorded at cost.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Depreciation is provided on the cost of buildings and improvements and equipment using the straight-line method.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Leasehold improvements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are amortized using the straight-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	line method over the terms of the leases or the useful lives of the assets, whichever is shorter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Maintenance and repairs are expensed and renewals and betterments are capitalized.&nbsp;&nbsp;When assets are retired or otherwise disposed of, the assets and accumulated depreciation are removed from the respective accounts and any profit or loss on the disposition is credited or charged to &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Goodwill and Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Intangible assets with an indefinite useful life are not amortized until their useful life is determined to be no longer indefinite and are tested for impairment annually or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances indicate that the asset might be impaired.&nbsp;&nbsp;Goodwill is not amortized but tested for impairment for each reporting unit on an annual basis and between annual tests in certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	To derive the fair value of the Company&#x2019;s sole reporting unit, the Company uses an income approach along with an analysis of its stock value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the income approach, fair value of a reporting unit is determined based on estimated future cash flows discounted by an estimated weighted-average cost of capital, which reflects the overall level of inherent risk of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Estimated future cash flows are based on the Company&#x2019;s internal projection model.&nbsp;&nbsp;The stock value evaluation consists of measuring the average market capitalization of the Company against its total asset value of its sole reporting unit.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company completes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	an impairment test annually
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	See Note 1(l) to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K for more information on the Company&#x2019;s impairment of long-lived assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Item 7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations: (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:12.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:12.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Revenue from the sale of products to the Company&#x2019;s customers is recognized at the point of sale.&nbsp;&nbsp;Discounts provided to customers at the point of sale through the Weis Club Preferred Shopper loyalty program are recognized as a reduction in sales as products are sold.&nbsp;&nbsp;Periodically, the Company will run a point based sales incentive program that rewards customers with future sales discounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company makes reasonable and reliable estimates of the amount of future discounts based upon historical experience and its customer data tracking software.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales are reduced by these estimates over the life of the program.&nbsp;&nbsp;Discounts to customers at the point of sale provided by vendors, usually in the form of paper coupons, are not recognized as a reduction in sales provided the discounts are redeemable at any retailer that accepts those discounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company records &#x201C;Deferred revenue&#x201D; for the sale of gift cards and revenue is recognized in &#x201C;Net sales&#x201D; at the time of customer redemption for products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gift card breakage income is recognized in &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses&#x201D; based upon historical redemption patterns and represents the balance of gift cards for which the Company believes the likelihood of redemption by the customer is remote.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales tax is excluded from &#x201C;Net sales.&#x201D;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company charges sales tax on all taxable customer purchases and remits these taxes monthly to the appropriate taxing jurisdiction.&nbsp;&nbsp;Merchandise return activity is immaterial to revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TMS RMN;">
	due to products being returned quickly and the unit cost is relatively low.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:12.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:12.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Vendor Allowances
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Vendor allowances related to the Company's buying and merchandising activities are recorded as a reduction of cost of sales as they are earned, in accordance with the underlying agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Off-invoice and bill-back allowances are used to reduce direct product costs upon the receipt of goods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Promotional rebates and credits are accounted for as a reduction in the cost of inventory and recognized when the related inventory is sold.&nbsp;&nbsp;Volume incentive discounts are realized as a reduction of cost of sales at the time it is deemed probable and reasonably estimable that the incentive target will be reached.&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term contract incentives, which require an exclusive vendor relationship, are allocated over the life of the contract.&nbsp;&nbsp;Promotional allowance funds for specific vendor-sponsored programs are recognized as a reduction of cost of sales as the program occurs and the funds are earned per the agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash discounts for prompt payment of invoices are realized in cost of sales as invoices are paid.&nbsp;&nbsp;Warehouse and back-haul allowances provided by suppliers for distributing their product through the Company&#x2019;s distribution system are recorded in cost of sales as the required performance is completed.&nbsp;&nbsp;Warehouse rack and slotting allowances are recorded in cost of sales when new items are initially set up in the Company's distribution system, which is when the related expenses are incurred and performance under the agreement is complete.&nbsp;&nbsp;Swell allowances for damaged goods are realized in cost of sales as provided by the supplier, helping to offset product shrink losses also recorded in cost of sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Store
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Closing Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company provides for closed store liabilities relating to the estimated post-closing lease liabilities and related other exit costs associated with the store closing commitments.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Currently, closed stores have remaining lease terms ranging from one to three years, and the liabilities associated with these closed store leases are paid over the terms of the lease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Closed store lease liabilities totaled $212,000 and $9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5,000 as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, respectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company estimates the lease liabilities, net of estimated sublease income, using the undiscounted rent payments of closed stores.&nbsp;&nbsp;Other exit costs include estimated real estate taxes, common area maintenance, insurance and utility costs to be incurred after the store closes over the remaining lease term.&nbsp;&nbsp;Store closings are generally completed within one year after the decision to close.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjustments to closed store liabilities and other exit costs primarily relate to changes in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	sublease income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and actual exit costs differing from original estimates.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjustments are made for changes in estimates in the period in which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	changes become known.&nbsp;&nbsp;Any excess store closing liability remaining upon settlement of the obligation is reversed to income in the period that such settlement is determined.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Store closing liabilities are reviewed quarterly to ensure that any accrued amount that is not a sufficient estimate of future costs, or that is no longer needed for its originally intended purpose, is adjusted to income in the proper period.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inventory write-downs, if any, in connection with store closings, are classified in cost of sales.&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs to transfer inventory and equipment from closed stores are expensed as incurred.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Self-Insurance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company is self-insured for a majority of its workers&#x2019; compensation, general liability, vehicle accident and associate medical benefit claims.&nbsp;&nbsp;The self
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	-insurance liability for most of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	medical benefit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	claims is determined based on historical data and an estimate of claims incurred but not reported.&nbsp;&nbsp;The other self-insurance liabilities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	including workers&#x2019; compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are determined actuarially, based on claims filed and an estimate of claims incurred but not yet reported.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company was liable for associate health claims up to an annual maximum of $1,250,000 per member prior to March 1, 2013, $2,000,000 per member prior to March 1, 2014 and an unlimited amount per member as of March 1, 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;As of March 1, 2014, the Company purchased stop loss insurance which carries a $500,000 specific deductible with a $250,000 aggregating deductible.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is liable for workers' compensation claims up to $2,000,000 per claim
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Property and casualty insurance coverage is maintained with outside carriers at deductible or retention levels ranging from $100,000 to $1,000,000.&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant assumptions used in the development of the actuarial estimates include reliance on the Company&#x2019;s historical claims data including average monthly claims and average lag time between incurrence and reporting of the claim.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

	WEIS MARKETS, INC.

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:05.24%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:02.42%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:05.12%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>

	22,986&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:03.98%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	17,965&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO THE
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:12PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following is a summary of the significant accounting policies utilized in preparing the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;Description of Business
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. is a Pennsylvania business corporation formed in 1924.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is engaged principally in the retail sale of food in Pennsylvania and surrounding states.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s operations are reported as a single reportable segment.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	There was no material change in the nature of the Company's business during fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:13PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;Definition of Fiscal Year
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s fiscal year ends on the last Saturday in December.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was comprised of 52 weeks, ending on December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was comprised of 52 weeks, ending on December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Fiscal 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was comprised of 52 weeks
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, ending on December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	References to years in this
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	nnual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	R
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eport relate to fiscal years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;Principles of Consolidation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	include the accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries.&nbsp;&nbsp;All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;Use of Estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Management of the Company has made a number of estimates and assumptions relating to the reporting of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities to prepare these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.&nbsp;&nbsp;Actual results could differ from those estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(e)&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Correction for Immaterial Prior Period Misstatements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL UNICODE MS;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	he Company corrected the &#x201C;Loss (gain) on disposition/impairment of fixed assets&#x201D; originally reported as a net loss of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in the 2013 Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows into the &#x201C;Gain on disposition of fixed assets&#x201D; of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million and the &#x201C;Impairment of fixed assets&#x201D; of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	million. There is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	cash impact on the 2013 Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows related to this change, since both line items still net to the originally reported $55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash and Cash Equivalents
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company maintains its cash balances in the form of core checking accounts and money market accounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company maintains cash deposits with banks that at times exceed applicable insurance limits.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reduces its exposure to credit risk by maintaining such deposits with high quality financial institutions that management believes are creditworthy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company considers investments with an original maturity of three months or less to be cash equivalents.&nbsp;&nbsp;Investment amounts classified as cash equivalents as of December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	26
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	14.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(g)&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Investments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Marketable securities consist of municipal bonds and equity securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company invests primarily in high-grade marketable debt securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company classifies all of its marketable securities as available-for-sale.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Available-for-sale securities are recorded at fair value as determined by quoted market price based on national markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrealized holding gains and losses, net of the related tax effect, are excluded from earnings and are reported as a separate component of shareholders&#x2019; equity until realized.&nbsp;&nbsp;A decline in the fair value below cost that is deemed other than temporary results in a charge to earnings and the establishment of a new cost basis for the security.&nbsp;&nbsp;Dividend and interest income is recognized when earned.&nbsp;&nbsp;Realized gains and losses are included in earnings and are derived using the specific identification method for determining the cost of securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;Accounts Receivable
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Accounts receivable are stated net of an allowance for uncollectible accounts of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	967
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	57
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The reserve balance relates to amounts due from pharmacy third party providers, retail customer returned checks, manufacturing customers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	vendors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and tenants
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company maintains an allowance for the amount of receivables deemed to be uncollectible and calculates this amount based upon historical collection activity adjusted for current conditions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Customer electronic payments accepted at the point of sale are classified as accounts receivable until collected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	27
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventories
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inventories are valued at the lower of cost or market, using both the last-in, first-out (LIFO) and average cost methods.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s center store and pharmacy inventories are valued using LIFO and the Company&#x2019;s fresh inventories are valued using average cost.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company evaluates inventory shortages throughout the year based on actual physical counts in its facilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Allowances for inventory shortages are recorded based on the results of these counts and to provide for estimated shortages from the last physical count to the financial statement date.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;Property and Equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Property and equipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	recorded at cost.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Depreciation is provided on the cost of buildings and improvements and equipment using the straight-line method
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Leasehold improvements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	amortized using
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the straight-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	line method over the terms of the leases or the useful lives of the assets, whichever is shorter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Maintenance and repairs are expensed and renewals and betterments are capitalized.&nbsp;&nbsp;When assets are retired or otherwise disposed of, the assets and accumulated depreciation are removed from the respective accounts and any profit or loss on the disposition is credited or charged to &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;Goodwill and Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Intangible assets with an indefinite useful life are not amortized until their useful life is determined to be no longer indefinite and are tested for impairment annually or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances indicate that the asset might be impaired.&nbsp;&nbsp;Goodwill is not amortized but tested for imp
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	airment for each reporting unit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	on an annual basis and between annual tests
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	when indicators of impairment are identified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	To derive the fair value of the Company&#x2019;s sole reporting unit, the Company uses an income approach along with an analysis of its stock value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the income approach, fair value of a reporting unit is determined based on estimated future cash flows discounted by an estimated weighted-average cost of capital, which reflects the overall level of inherent risk of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Estimated future cash flows are based on the Company&#x2019;s internal projection model.&nbsp;&nbsp;The stock value evaluation consists of measuring the average market capitalization of the Company against its total asset value of its sole reporting unit.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s intangible assets and related accumulated amortization at December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	consisted of the following:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:07.60%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:10.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(l)&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment of Long-Lived Assets
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company periodically evaluates the period of depreciation or amortization for long-lived assets to determine whether current circumstances warrant revised estimates of useful lives.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company completes an impairment test annually.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company also reviews its property and equipment for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate the carrying value of an asset may not be recoverable.&nbsp;&nbsp;Recoverability is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount to the net undiscounted cash flows expected to be generated by the asset.&nbsp;&nbsp;An impairment loss would be recorded for the excess of net book value over the fair value of the asset impaired.&nbsp;&nbsp;The fair value is estimated based on expected discounted future cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	With respect to owned property and equipment associated with closed stores, the value of the property and equipment is adjusted to reflect recoverable values based on the Company&#x2019;s prior history of disposing of similar assets and current economic conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In accordance with Accounting Standards Codification No. 360,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the Company recorded a pre-tax charge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in the third quarter of 2013 for the impairment of long-lived assets, including equipment and leasehold improvements. The charge was a result of management determining that the net book value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	properties was impaired. This charge was included as a component of "Operating, general and administrative expenses."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The results of impairment tests are subject to management&#x2019;s estimates and assumptions of projected cash flows and operating results.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company believes that, based on current conditions, materially different reported results are not likely to result from long-lived asset impairments.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, a change in assumptions or market conditions could result in a change in estimated future cash flows and the likelihood of materially different reported results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(m)&nbsp;&nbsp;Store Closing Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company provides for closed store liabilities relating to the estimated post-closing lease liabilities and related other exit costs associated with the store closing commitments.&nbsp;&nbsp;Currently, closed stores have remaining lease terms ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years, and the liabilities associated with these closed store leases are paid over the terms of the lease.&nbsp;&nbsp;Closed store lease liabilities totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	212
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	955
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	as of December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and December 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company estimates the lease liabilities, net of estimated sublease income, using the undiscounted rent payments of closed stores.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Other exit costs include estimated real estate taxes, common area maintenance, insurance and utility costs to be incurred after the store closes over the remaining lease term.&nbsp;&nbsp;Store closings are generally completed within one year after the decision to close.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Adjustments to closed store liabilities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and other exit costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	primarily relate to changes in sublease income and actual exit costs differing from original estimates.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjustments are made for changes in estimates in the period in which the change
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	become known.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Any excess store closing liability remaining upon settlement of the obligation is re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	vers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ed to income in the period that such settlement is determined.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Store closing liabilities are reviewed quarterly to ensure that any accrued amount that is not a sufficient estimate of future costs, or that no longer is needed for its originally intended purpose, is adjusted to income in the proper period.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Inventory write-downs, if any, in connection with store closings are classified in cost of sales.&nbsp;&nbsp;Costs to transfer inventory and equipment from closed stores are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following table summarizes accrual activity for future lease obligations of stores that were closed in the normal course of business:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:49.88%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:16.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Balance at December 27, 2014
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:21.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:16.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.08%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:16.50PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:18.60%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:16.50PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	955&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:49.88%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">

	Additions
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:21.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.08%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:18.60%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	0&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:49.88%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Payments
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:21.44%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;

</TD>

	(578)
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:49.88%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

</TD>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(n)&nbsp;&nbsp;Self-Insurance
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company is self-insured for a majority of its workers&#x2019; compensation, general liability, vehicle accident and associate medical benefit claims.&nbsp;&nbsp;The self-insurance liability for most of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	medical benefit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	claims is determined based on historical data and an estimate of claims incurred but not reported.&nbsp;&nbsp;The other self-insurance liabilities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	including workers&#x2019; compensation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	are determined actuarially, based on claims filed and an estimate of claims incurred but not yet reported.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company was liable for associate health claims up to an annual maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,250,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per member prior to March 1, 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per member prior to March 1, 2014 and an unlimited amount per member as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and after
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	March 1, 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;As of March 1, 2014, the Company purchased stop loss insurance which carries a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	specific deductible with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$250,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	aggregating deductible.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is liable for workers' compensation claims up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per claim
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Property and casualty insurance coverage is maintained with outside carriers at deductible or retention levels ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$100,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Significant assumptions used in the development of the actuarial estimates include reliance on the Company&#x2019;s historical claims data including average monthly claims and average lag time between incurrence and reporting of the claim.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(o)&nbsp;&nbsp;Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases.&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company reviews the tax positions taken or expected to be taken on tax returns to determine whether and to what extent a benefit can be recognized in our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Refer to Note 8 to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the amount of unrecognized tax benefits and other disclosures related to uncertain tax positions.&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent interest and penalties would be assessed by taxing authorities on any underpayment of income tax, such amounts are accrued and classified as a component of income tax expense.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(p)&nbsp;&nbsp;Earnings Per Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Earnings per share are based on the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(q)&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Revenue from the sale of products to the Company&#x2019;s customers is recognized at the point of sale.&nbsp;&nbsp;Discounts provided to customers at the point of sale through the Weis Club Preferred Shopper loyalty program are recognized as a reduction in sales as products are sold.&nbsp;&nbsp;Periodically, the Company will run a point based sales incentive program that rewards customers with future sales discounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company makes reasonable and reliable estimates of the amount of future discounts based upon historical experience and its customer data tracking software.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales are reduced by these estimates over the life of the program.&nbsp;&nbsp;Discounts to customers at the point of sale provided by vendors, usually in the form of paper coupons, are not recognized as a reduction in sales provided the discounts are redeemable at any retailer that accepts those discounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company records &#x201C;Deferred revenue&#x201D; for the sale of gift cards and revenue is recognized in &#x201C;Net sales&#x201D; at the time of customer redemption for products.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gift card breakage income is recognized in &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses&#x201D; based upon historical redemption patterns and represents the balance of gift cards for which the Company believes the likelihood of redemption by the customer is remote.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales tax is excluded from &#x201C;Net sales.&#x201D;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company charges sales tax on all taxable customer purchases and remits these taxes monthly to the appropriate taxing jurisdiction.&nbsp;&nbsp;Merchandise return activity is immaterial to revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TMS RMN;">
	due to products being returned quickly and the unit cost is relatively low.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(r)&nbsp;&nbsp;Cost of Sales, Including Warehousing and Distribution Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;Cost of sales, including warehousing and distribution expenses&#x201D; consists of direct product costs (net of discounts and allowances), distribution center and transportation costs, as well as manufacturing facility operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(s)&nbsp;&nbsp;Vendor Allowances
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Vendor allowances
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	related
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to the Company's buying and merchandising activities are recorded as a reduction of cost of sales as they are earned, in accordance with the underlying agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Off-invoice and bill-back allowances are used to reduce direct product costs upon the receipt of goods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Promotional rebates and credits are accounted for as a reduction in the cost of inventory and recognized when the related inventory is sold.&nbsp;&nbsp;Volume incentive discounts are realized as a reduction of cost of sales at the time it is deemed probable and reasonably estimable that the incentive target will be reached.&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-term contract incentives, which require an exclusive vendor relationship, are allocated over the life of the contract.&nbsp;&nbsp;Promotional allowance funds for specific vendor-sponsored programs are recognized as a reduction of cost of sales as the program occurs and the funds are earned per the agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash discounts for prompt payment of invoices are realized in cost of sales as invoices are paid.&nbsp;&nbsp;Warehouse and back-haul allowances provided by suppliers for distributing their product through the Company&#x2019;s distribution system are recorded in cost of sales as the required performance is completed.&nbsp;&nbsp;Warehouse rack and slotting allowances are recorded in cost of sales when new items are initially set up in the Company's distribution system, which is when the related expenses are incurred and performance under the agreement is complete.&nbsp;&nbsp;Swell allowances for damaged goods are realized in cost of sales as provided by the supplier, helping to offset product shrink losses also recorded in cost of sales.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(s)&nbsp;&nbsp;Vendor Allowances (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Vendor allowances recorded as credits in cost of sales totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	97.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	89.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	76.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201
</FONT>

	3

	.&nbsp;&nbsp;Vendor paid cooperative advertising credits totaled

	$

	17.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201

	5

	, &nbsp;
</FONT>

	$

	16.0
</FONT>

	million in 201

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</FONT>

	million in 201

	3
</FONT>

	.&nbsp;&nbsp;These credits were netted against advertising costs within &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses.&#x201D;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company had accounts receivable due from vendors of

	,000

	5

	7
</FONT>
