	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(t)&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating, General and Administrative Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Business operating costs including expenses generated from administration and purchasing functions, are recorded in &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses&#x201D; in the Consolidated Statements of Income.&nbsp;&nbsp;Business operating costs include items such as wages, benefits, utilities, repairs and maintenance, advertising costs and credits, rent, insurance, depreciation, leasehold amortization and costs for outside provided services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(u)&nbsp;&nbsp;Advertising Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company expenses advertising costs as incurred.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recorded advertising expense, before vendor paid cooperative advertising credits, of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	23.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	24.6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$23.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;Rental Income
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company leases or subleases space to tenants in owned, vacated and open store facilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;Rental income is recorded when earned as a component of &#x201C;Operating, general and administrative expenses.&#x201D;&nbsp;&nbsp;All leases are operating leases, as disclosed in Note 5.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(w) Basis of Presentation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In conjunction with the September 26, 2015 quarterly financial statement close process, and while researching alternative methods to calculate retained claim liability for the Company&#x2019;s self-insured workers compensation and general liability insurance programs, the Company discovered errors in the application of the actuarial methods used to estimate the obligation of future payments resulting from claims due to past events.&nbsp;&nbsp;These errors primarily related to the Company&#x2019;s selection of loss development factors and the application of such factors to the population of claims.&nbsp;&nbsp;The impact of these prior period misstatements to the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	resulted in the understatement of workers compensation and general liability expense with a corresponding understatement of self-insurance liabilities over multiple fiscal periods through June 27, 2015. Consequently, the Company has restated certain prior period amounts to correct these errors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Based on an analysis of quantitative and qualitative factors in accordance with SEC Staff Accounting Bulletins 99 and 108, the Company concluded that these errors were not material to the consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows as presented in the Company&#x2019;s quarterly and annual financial statements that have been previously filed in the Company&#x2019;s Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q and Annual Reports on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As a result, amendment of such reports was not required.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In preparing the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the thirteen and thirty-nine weeks ended September 26, 2015 and for each of the three years in the period ended December 26, 2015, the Company made appropriate revisions to its financial statements for historical periods.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Such changes were reflected in the financial results for the thirteen and thirty-nine weeks ended September 26, 2015 and are also reflected in the historical financial results included in these
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The effect of these errors decreased net income by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$786
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.03
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share, for the year ended December 27, 2014 and increased net income by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$0.05
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share, for the year ended December 28, 2013.&nbsp;&nbsp;These errors also increased total liabilities by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$13.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December 27, 2014 and reduced retained earnings by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$13.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million at December 29, 2012.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional information about these corrections, including a reconciliation of each financial statement line item affected, has been included in Note 7 to the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	contained in its Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the period ended September 26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">

</P>

	31

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(x
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	)&nbsp;&nbsp;Current Relevant Accounting Standards
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In April 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FASB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)&nbsp;&nbsp;issued Accounting Standards Update ("ASU") 2014-08,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation of Financial Statements (Topic 205) and Property, Plant and Equipment (Topic 360): Reporting Discontinued Operations and Disclosures of Disposals of Components of an Entity.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ASU 2014-08 amends guidance on reporting discontinued operations only if the disposal of a component of an entity or group of components of an entity represents a strategic shift that has (or will have) a major effect on an entity&#x2019;s operations and financial results. It also allows companies to have significant continuing involvement and continuing cash flows with the discontinued operations. Additional disclosures are also required for discontinued operations and individually material disposal transactions that do not meet the definition of a discontinued operation.&nbsp; The standard should be applied prospectively for all disposals of components of an entity and for all businesses that, on acquisition, are classified as held for sale that occurred within annual periods beginning on or after December 15, 2014, including interim periods within that reporting period.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adoption of the ASU did not have an impact on the Company&#x2019;s 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In May 2014, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FASB
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ASU
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014-09,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	which amended the existing accounting standards for revenue recognition.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU 2014-09 establishes principles for recognizing revenue upon the transfer of promised goods or services to customers, in an amount that reflects the expected consideration received in exchange for those goods or services.&nbsp;&nbsp;The standard
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	was initially
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	effective for annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016, including interim periods within that reporting period.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In August 2015, the FASB issued a one-year deferral of the effective date of this new guidance resulting in it now being effective for the Company beginning in fiscal year 2018.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Early adoption is not permitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendments may be applied retrospectively to each prior period presented or retrospectively with the cumulative effect recognized as of the date of initial application.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is currently in the process of evaluating the impact of adoption of the ASU on its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In August 2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-15,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation of Financial Statements &#x2013; Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40)(Topic 718): Disclosure of Uncertainties about an Entity&#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;ASU 2014-15 provides guidance related to management&#x2019;s responsibility to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about the entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern and to provide related footnote disclosures.&nbsp;&nbsp;The new requirements are effective for the annual periods ending after December 15, 2016, and for interim periods and annual periods thereafter.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adoption of the new ASU will not have an impact on the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In July 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-11,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Inventory (Topic 330):&nbsp;&nbsp;Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU 2015-11 amends guidance on the measurement of inventory from lower of cost or market to net realizable value.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendment applies to all inventory other than those measured by Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) and the Retail Inventory Method (RIM).&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendment is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2016, including interim periods within that reporting period.&nbsp;&nbsp;Early adoption is permitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adoption
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the new ASU will not have a material
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	impact on the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In September 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-16,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business Combinations (Topic 805): Simplifying the Accounting for Measurement-Period Adjustments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU 2015-16 requires that any effect on earnings due to depreciation, amortization or other income effects, due to a change to the provisional amounts be recorded in the current period&#x2019;s financial statements as if the accounting had been completed at the acquisition date.&nbsp;&nbsp;The portion of the amount recorded in the current-period earnings, which would have been recorded in the previous reporting periods if the adjustment to the provisional amounts had been recognized as of the acquisition date, must be presented separately on the face of the income statement or disclosed in the notes to the financial statements by line item.&nbsp;&nbsp;The amendment is effective for the fiscal year beginning after December 15, 2015. The amendments are to be applied prospectively to any adjustments occurring after the effective date. Adoption of this ASU is not expected to have a material impact on the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In November 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income Taxes (Topic 740): Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU 2015-17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	simplifies the presentation of deferred income taxes and requires
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	that deferred tax liabilities and assets be classified as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	noncurrent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in a classified statement of financial
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	position.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Company adopted ASU 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	015-17
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the fiscal year ended Decem
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r 26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and applied it retrospectively
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company reclassified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$5.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million out of &#x201C;Total current liabilities&#x201D; related to &#x201C;Deferred income taxes&#x201D; in the December 27, 2014 Consolidated Balance Sheet and into noncurrent &#x201C;Deferred income taxes.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A HREF="#WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TABLE_OF_CONTENTS">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(x)&nbsp;&nbsp;Current Relevant Accounting Standards (continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-02
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases (Topic 842).&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ASU 2016-02 requires lessees to recognize assets and liabilities for the rights and obligations created by their leases with lease terms more than 12 months.&nbsp;&nbsp;Current guidance only requires capital leases to be recognized on the balance sheet.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, the ASU 2016-02 now requires that both capital and operating leases be recognized on the balance sheet.&nbsp;&nbsp;The effect on cash flows will strictly depend on whether the lease is classified as an operating lease o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	capital lease.&nbsp;&nbsp;The ASU 2016-02 will require disclosures to aid investors and other financial statement users to better understand the amount, timing and uncertainty of the cash flows arising from leases.&nbsp;&nbsp;These disclosures are to include qualitative and quantitative information about the amounts recorded in the financial statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;This update remains unchanged for lessors. However, new guidance contains targeted improvements to align, where necessary, the lessor&#x2019;s accounting with the lessee&#x2019;s accounting standards.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU 2016-02 will become effective for annual periods beginning after December 15, 2018 and for interim periods within those fiscal years.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company is currently in the process of evaluating the impact of adoption of the ASU on its
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 2&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s marketable securities are all classified as available-for-sale within &#x201C;Current Assets&#x201D; in the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	FASB has established three levels of inputs that may be used to measure fair value:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Level 1&nbsp;&nbsp;Observable inputs such as quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Level 2&nbsp;&nbsp;Observable inputs, other than Level 1 inputs in active markets, that are observable either directly or indirectly; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Level 3&nbsp;&nbsp;Unobservable inputs for which there is little or no market data, which require the reporting entity to develop its own assumptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s marketable securities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	valued using Level 1 inputs include highly liquid equity securities, for which quoted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	market prices are available
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	bond portfolio is valued using Level 2 inputs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#FF0000;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	bonds are valued using a combination of pricing for similar securities, recently executed transactions, cash flow models with yield curves and other pricing models utilizing observable inputs, which are considered Level 2 inputs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For Level 2 investment valuation, the Company utilizes standard pricing procedures of its investment advisory firm(s), which include various third party pricing services.&nbsp;&nbsp;These procedures also require specific price monitoring practices as well as pricing review reports, valuation oversight and pricing challenge procedures to maintain the most accurate representation of investment fair market value.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the Company engages an independent firm to value a sample of the Company&#x2019;s municipal bond holdings annually in order to validate the investment&#x2019;s assigned fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:13PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company accrues interest on its bond portfolio throughout the life of each bond held.&nbsp;&nbsp;Dividends from the equity securities are recognized as received.&nbsp;&nbsp;Both interest and dividends are recognized in &#x201C;Investment income&#x201D; on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Statements of Income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:13PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:13PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Marketable securities, as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, consisted of:
</FONT>
<BR />
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_16"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company also maintains a non-qualified supplemental executive retirement plan and a non-qualified pharmacist deferred compensation plan for certain of its associates which allows them to defer income to future periods.&nbsp;&nbsp;Participants in the plans earn a return on their deferrals based on mutual fund investments.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company chooses to invest in the underlying mutual fund investments to offset the liability associated with the non-qualified deferred compensation plans.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such investments are reported on the balance sheet as SERP investments, are classified as trading securities and are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	measured
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at fair value using
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Level 1 inputs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with gains and losses included in investment income.&nbsp;&nbsp;The changes in the underlying liability to the employee are recorded in operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:13PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Management
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	believes the use of the LIFO method for valuing certain inventories represents the most appropriate matching of costs and revenues in the Company&#x2019;s circumstances.&nbsp;&nbsp;If all inventories were valued on the average cost method, which approximates current cost, total inventories would have been $81,347,000 and $79,933,000 higher than as reported on the above methods as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, respectively. During 2015, the Company had certain decrements in its LIFO pools, which had an insignificant impact on the cost of sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<A NAME="WMK10K2015_10K_HTM__CONTENTSECTION_561F62A0_B6C2_4FA7_BF87_">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 5&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease Commitments&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At December 26, 2015, the Company leased approximately 50% of its open store facilities under operating leases that expire at various dates through 2029.&nbsp;&nbsp;These leases generally provide for fixed annual rentals; however, several provide for minimum annual rentals plus contingent rentals as a percentage of annual sales and a number of leases require the Company to pay for all or a portion of insurance, real estate taxes, water and sewer rentals, and repairs, the cost of which is charged to the related expense category rather than being accounted for as rent expense.&nbsp;&nbsp;Most of the leases contain multiple renewal options, under which the Company may extend the lease terms from 5 to 20 years.&nbsp;&nbsp;Rents on operating leases, including agreements with step rents, are charged to expense on a straight-line basis over the minimum lease term.&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally, the Company has operating leases for certain transportation and other equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Rent expense and income on all leases consisted of:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	The Company has $32,000 accrued as of December 26, 2015 and had $455,000 accrued as of December 27, 2014, for future minimum rental payments due on previously closed stores, reduced by the estimated sublease income to be received.&nbsp;&nbsp;The future minimum rental payments required under operating leases and estimated sublease income for these locations are included in the above schedule.

	Table of Contents

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 6&nbsp;&nbsp;Retirement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company has a retirement savings plan, the Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan, covering substantially all full-time associates.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	plan has a contributory component as well as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a noncontributory profit-sharing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	component for certain associates.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The noncontributory component
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	cover
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	eligible associates which included certain salaried associates, store management and administrative support personnel.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company also has three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	non-qualified
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	supplemental retirement plans covering highly compensated employees of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s policy is to fund
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	etirement plan costs as accrued,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	with the exception of the deferred compensation plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;Employer contributions to the qualified retirement plans are made at the sole discretion of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:13PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Retirement plan costs:
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:08.04%;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;HEIGHT:12.75PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company maintains a non-qualified deferred compensation plan for the payment of specific amounts of annual retirement benefits to certain officers or their beneficiaries over an actuarially computed normal life expectancy.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Currently, there are no active officers in the plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;The expected payments under the plan provisions were determined through actuarial calculations dependent on the age of the recipient, using an assumed discount rate.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The plan is unfunded and accounted for on an accrual basis.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The recorded liability at December 26, 2015 is $7,264,000, which is based on expected payments to be made over the remaining lives of the beneficiaries.&nbsp;&nbsp;This amount is included in &#x201C;Accrued expenses&#x201D; and &#x201C;Postretirement benefit obligations&#x201D; in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.&nbsp;&nbsp;The expected payment amounts are approximately $1,975,000 for each of 2016 and 2017, and approximately $1,013,000 for the years thereafter dependent on the lives of the beneficiaries
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company also maintains a non-qualified supplemental executive retirement plan and a non-qualified pharmacist deferred compensation plan for certain of its associates.&nbsp;&nbsp;These plans are designed to provide retirement benefits and salary deferral opportunities because of limitations imposed by the Internal Revenue Code and the Regulations implemented by the Internal Revenue Service.&nbsp;&nbsp;These plans are unfunded and accounted for on an accrual basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;Participants in these plans are excluded from participation in the profit sharing portion of the Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan once their yearly earnings exceed the IRS highly compensated threshold.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Board of Directors annually determines the amount of the allocation to the plans at its sole discretion.&nbsp;&nbsp;The allocation among the various plan participants is made in both flat dollar amounts and in relationship to their compensation.&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan participants are 100% vested in their accounts after six years of service with the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefits are distributed among participants upon reaching the applicable retirement age.&nbsp;&nbsp;Substantial risk of benefit forfeiture does exist for participants in these plans.&nbsp;&nbsp;The present value of accumulated benefits amounted to $9,079,000 and $9,646,000 at December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, respectively, and is included in &#x201C;Postretirement benefit obligations&#x201D; in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has no other postretirement benefit plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 7&nbsp;&nbsp;Accumulated Other Comprehensive Income
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	All balances in accumulated other comprehensive income are related to available-for-sale marketable securities.&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets forth the balance of the Company&#x2019;s accumulated other comprehensive income, net of tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

	T

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he Company adopted ASU 2015-17 for the fiscal year ended December 26, 2015 and applied it retrospectively. The Company reclassified $5.8 million out of &#x201C;Total current liabilities&#x201D; related to &#x201C;Deferred income taxes&#x201D; in the December 27, 2014 Consolidated Balance Sheet and into noncurrent &#x201C;Deferred income taxes.&#x201D;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The total amount of unrecognized tax benefits that, if recognized, would affect the effective tax rate was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,264
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000 in 2015 and $0 in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he Company&#x2019;s U.S. Federal income tax filings have been examined by the Internal Revenue Service through 2008.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company or one of its subsidiaries files tax returns in various states.&nbsp;&nbsp;The tax years subject to examination in Pennsylvania, where the majority of the Company's revenues ar
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e generated, are 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company has net operating loss carryforwards of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	88
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million available for state income tax purposes.&nbsp;&nbsp;The net operating losses will begin to expire starting in 2027.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company expects to fully utilize these net operating loss carryforwards.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 9&nbsp;&nbsp;Acquisition of Business
</FONT>
<BR />
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Fiscal 2015 Acquisitions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company paid $7.9 million for the property and equipment related to the purchase of a store in Hanover, Pennsylvania on August 31, 2015 from C&amp;S Wholesale Grocers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to expand current market share
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The purchase price was allocated between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	land, building and equipment of $1.9 million,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5.9 million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$112
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	,000, respectively,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in accordance with our accounting policies for business combinations.&nbsp;&nbsp;No Goodwill was recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Fiscal 2014 Acquisitions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	There were no acquisitions for fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:03.38%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:11.78%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.50&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:03.92%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:11.24%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:12.75PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">

	.51&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 11&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair Value Information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The carrying amounts for cash, accounts receivable and accounts payable approximate fair value because of the short maturities of these instruments.&nbsp;&nbsp;The fair values of the Company&#x2019;s marketable securities, as disclosed in Note 2, are based on quoted market prices and institutional pricing guidelines for those securities not classified as Level 1 securities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	SERP investments are classified as trading securities and are carried at fair value using Level 1 inputs.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:16PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 12&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Commitments and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contingencies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company is involved in various legal actions arising out of the normal course of business.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company also accrues for tax contingencies when it is probable that a liability to a taxing authority has been incurred and the amount of the contingency can be reasonably estimated, based on experience.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the opinion of management, the ultimate disposition of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on the Company's consolidated financial position, results of operations or liquidity.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At December 26, 2015, the Company had a $30 million line of credit, of which $16.9 million was committed to outstanding letters of credit.&nbsp;&nbsp;The letters of credit are maintained primarily to support performance, payment, deposit or surety obligations of the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company does not anticipate drawing on any of them.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has a $50 million short-term credit facility agreement to fund future financing activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">

	&nbsp;

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:104PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Board of Directors and Shareholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Weis Markets, Inc. as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, shareholders' equity and cash flows for each of the 52 week periods ended December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014. Our audits also included the financial statement schedule for each of the 52 week periods ended December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014 at Item 15(c)(3). These financial statements and schedule are the responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and schedule based on our audits
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of Weis Markets, Inc. at December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, and the consolidated results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the 52 week periods ended December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles. Also in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule for each of the 52 week periods ended December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, when considered in relation to the basic
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	taken as a whole, presents fairly in all material respects the information set forth therein
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), Weis Markets, Inc.&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 26, 2015, based on criteria established in Internal Control-Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (1992 framework), and our report dated March 18, 2016, expressed an unqualified opinion thereon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	/S/Ernst &amp; Young LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
</FONT>
<BR />
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	March 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Board of Directors and Shareholders of
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Weis Markets, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have audited Weis Markets Inc.&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 26, 2015, based on criteria established in Internal Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (1992 framework)&nbsp;&nbsp;(the COSO criteria). Weis Markets, Inc.&#x2019;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying Management&#x2019;s Report On Internal Control Over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#x2019;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:115%;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In our opinion, Weis Markets, Inc. maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 26, 2015, based on the COSO criteria
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated balance sheets of Weis Markets, Inc. as of December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, shareholders' equity and cash flows for each of the 52 week periods ended December 26, 2015 and December 27, 2014 of Weis Markets, Inc. and our report dated March 18, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	/S/Ernst &amp; Young LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
</FONT>
<BR />
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	March 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT -0.75PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	WEIS MARKETS, INC.

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Board of Directors and Shareholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, shareholders&#x2019; equity, and cash flows for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. Our audit of the basic
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	included the financial statement schedule listed in the index appearing under Item 15(c)(3).&nbsp;&nbsp;These financial statements and financial statement schedule are the responsibility of the Company&#x2019;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and financial statement schedule based on our audit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In our opinion, the Consolidated Financial Statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the results of operations and cash flows
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of Weis Markets, Inc.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the period ended December 28, 2013 in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. In addition, in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic Consolidated Financial Statements taken as a whole, presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	/S/Grant Thornton LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
</FONT>
<BR />
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	March 18, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 14.2PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 9.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<A NAME="WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TOC_ITEM_9_CHANGESINANDDISAGREEMENTS">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Changes in and Disagreements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	None.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Item 9a.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<A NAME="WMK10K2015_10K_HTM_TOC_ITEM_9A_CONTROLSANDPROCEDURES">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Management&#x2019;s Report on Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer of the Company (its principal executive officer and principal financial officer, respectively) have concluded, based on their evaluation as of the close of the period covered by this Report, that the Company's disclosure controls and procedures are effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed by the Company in the reports filed or submitted by it under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the SEC's rules and forms, and include controls and procedures designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed by the Company in such reports is accumulated and communicated to the Company's management, including the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Management's Report on Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	he management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(as defined in Rules 13a-15(f) under the Exchange Act)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Under the supervision and with the participation of management, including the Company&#x2019;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, the Company conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting based on the framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in Internal Control &#x2013; Integrated Framework (1992 framework).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s internal control system was designed to provide reasonable assurance to the Company&#x2019;s management and board of directors regarding the preparation and fair presentation of published financial statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;All internal control systems, no matter how well designed, have inherent limitations.&nbsp;&nbsp;Therefore, even those systems determined to be effective can provide only reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and presentation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Based on the Company&#x2019;s evaluation, management concluded that the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 26, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	s previously disclosed in Item 4 of our Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the fiscal quarter ended September 26, 2015, management concluded that there was a material weakness in internal controls over the preparation and review of our self-insurance reserve calculations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	and that our internal controls over financial reporting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	were not designed to prevent or detect a material error
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	as of September 26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	A material weakness is a deficiency, or a combination of deficiencies, in internal control over financial reporting, such that there is a reasonable possibility that a material misstatement of the Company&#x2019;s annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	material weakness
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	resulted in an understatement of those reserves in our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	previously issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	financial statements. The impact of those errors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	corrected
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	and presented in our Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the fiscal quarter ended September 26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp; Subsequent to the quarter ended September 26, 2015, the Company engaged a casualty actuarial services company to perform an actuarial analysis to assist in the determination of the appropriate reserve balances.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	The Company also implemented management review controls over the completeness, accuracy and reasonableness of the actuary&#x2019;s estimate of the reserve balance.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	Based upon the remedial actions taken and our testing and evaluation of the design and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	operating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	effectiveness of these internal controls, we have concluded the material weakness in internal control over financial reporting related to the preparation and review of our self-insurance reserves calculations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	was remediated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	as of December 26, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	has audited the Consolidated Financial Statements included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and, as part of their audit,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	has issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	their
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	attestation report on the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 26, 2015. The report can be found in Item 8 of this
</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
