	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with the regulations prescribed by the Secretary of Labor under ERISA section&nbsp;404(c)(5) until such time as the participant makes an affirmative investment election.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 14PT">
<A NAME="WMK10K2015EX10-A_HTM__TOC434841010">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ARTICLE IV &#x2013; PAYMENT OF PARTICIPANT ACCOUNTS
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:3PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<A NAME="WMK10K2015EX10-A_HTM__TOC434841011">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Section 4.1 &#x2013; Vesting Service Rules
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Vesting Year of Service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	means a vesting computation period during which the employee completes at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;hours of service with the employer.&nbsp;&nbsp;All of an employee's years of service with the employer shall be counted to determine the nonforfeitable percentage in the employee's account balance(s) derived from employer contributions, except:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Years of service disregarded under the break in service rules in Section&nbsp;4.1(d) below.&nbsp;&nbsp;(Post-ERISA break in service rules)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Years of service before the effective date of ERISA if such service would have been disregarded under the break in service rules of the prior plan in effect from time to time before such date.&nbsp;&nbsp;For this purpose, break in service rules are rules that result in the loss of prior vesting or benefit accruals, or that deny an employee eligibility to participate, by reason of separation or failure to complete a required period of service within a specified period of time.&nbsp;&nbsp;(Pre-ERISA break in service rules)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	One Year Break in Service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	means for the purposes of this Article&nbsp;IV a vesting computation period during which the employee or former employee does not complete more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;hours of service with the employer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Vesting Computation Period
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	means the 12-consecutive-month period coinciding with the plan year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(d)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Break in Service Rules
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Vested Participant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; A former participant who had a nonforfeitable right to all or a portion of his account balance(s) derived from employer contributions or who (effective for plan years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) had made an employee elective deferral contribution at the time of his termination from service shall retain credit for all vesting years of service prior to a break in service as that term is defined in Section&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.1(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Nonvested Participant or Employee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; In the case of a former participant or employee who did not have any nonforfeitable right to his account balance(s) derived from employer contributions and who (effective for plan years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) had made no employee elective deferral contribution at the time of his termination from service, years of service before a period of consecutive one-year breaks in service shall not be taken into account in computing service if the number of consecutive one-year breaks in service in such period equals or exceeds the greater of&nbsp;5 or the aggregate number of years of service before such breaks in service.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such aggregate number of years of service shall not include any years of service disregarded under the preceding sentence by reason of prior breaks in service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Vesting for Pre-Break and Post-Break Accounts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; In the case of a participant or employee who has five or more consecutive one-year breaks in service, all years of service after such breaks in service shall be disregarded for the purpose of vesting the employer-derived account balance(s) that accrued before such breaks in service.&nbsp;&nbsp;Whether or not such pre-break service counts in vesting the post-break employer-derived account balance(s) shall be determined according to the rules set forth in Section&nbsp;4.1(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	)(1) and (2) above.&nbsp;&nbsp;Separate accounts shall be maintained for each of the participant&#x2019;s pre-break and post-break employer-derived account balance(s).&nbsp;&nbsp;All accounts shall share in the investment earnings and losses of the fund.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:3PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<A NAME="WMK10K2015EX10-A_HTM__TOC434841012">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Section 4.2 &#x2013; Vesting of Participant Accounts
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Determination of Vesting
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Normal Retirement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; An employee's right to his account balance(s) shall be 100% vested and nonforfeitable upon the attainment of age
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	65
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, the normal retirement age.&nbsp;&nbsp;The vesting of an inactive participant who terminates employment prior to normal retirement age shall remain subject to the
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	19
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	provisions of the vesting schedule following attainment of such specified age.&nbsp;&nbsp;Distributions shall be administered in accordance with termination from employment provisions of Section&nbsp;4.3(a)(3).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Late Retirement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If a participant remains employed after his normal retirement age, his account balance(s) shall remain 100% vested and nonforfeitable.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such participant shall continue to receive allocations to his account as he did before his normal retirement age.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Early Retirement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; In the case of a participant who has attained age&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	60
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and completed&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years of service before his normal retirement age, the participant's right to his account balance(s) shall be 100% vested and nonforfeitable.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such participant may retire before his normal retirement age without the consent of the employer and receive payment of benefits from the plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;If a participant separates from service before satisfying the age requirement for early retirement, but has satisfied the service requirement, the participant shall be entitled to elect an early retirement benefit upon satisfaction of such age requirement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Disability
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If a participant separates from service due to disability, such participant&#x2019;s right to his account balance(s) as of his date of disability shall be 100% vested and nonforfeitable.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Disability means the participant has been determined by the Social Security Administration to be eligible for either full or partial Social Security disability benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT -6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(5)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:6PT;PADDING:0PT 27PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:8PT;PADDING:0PT 27PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Death
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; In the event of the death of a participant who has an accrued benefit under the plan (whether or not he is an active participant), 100% of the participant&#x2019;s account balance(s) as of the date of death shall be paid to his surviving spouse; except that, if there is no surviving spouse, or if the surviving spouse has already consented in a manner that is (or conforms to) a qualified election under the joint and survivor annuity provisions of Code section&nbsp;417(a) and regulations issued pursuant thereto and as set forth in Section&nbsp;5.2, then such balance(s) shall be paid to the participant's designated beneficiary.&nbsp;&nbsp;The payment options available to the beneficiary shall be those payment options available to the participant under Section&nbsp;4.3(b).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Beneficiary Designation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Subject to the spousal consent requirements of Section 5.2, the participant shall have the right to designate his beneficiaries, including a contingent death beneficiary, and shall have the right at any time prior to his death to change such beneficiaries. The designation shall be effective only if made in writing on a form signed by the participant and supplied by and filed with the plan administrator prior to his death.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the participant fails to designate a beneficiary, or if the designated person or persons predecease the participant, "beneficiary" shall mean: (a) the spouse, (b) if no surviving spouse, then to the surviving children in equal shares, (c) if no surviving children, then to the surviving parents in equal shares, (d) if no surviving parents, then to the surviving brothers and sisters in equal shares, (e) if no surviving brothers and sisters, then (f) to the participant&#x2019;s estate if an estate is opened within 2 years of the participant&#x2019;s death; and otherwise to a charity selected in the sole discretion of the plan administrator.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If a designated beneficiary dies after the participant has died but before the plan has commenced or made distribution to the designated beneficiary, the plan shall be administered as set forth in this paragraph.&nbsp;&nbsp;The death benefit will be paid to the beneficiary&#x2019;s designated beneficiary, if any designated prior to such beneficiary&#x2019;s death in connection with the beneficiary&#x2019;s election of a form of payment of the participant&#x2019;s death benefit to which he is entitled; and if no such designation is on file with the plan administrator, then to the beneficiary's estate in a single lump sum payment if an estate is opened within 2 years of the participant&#x2019;s death; and otherwise to a charity selected in the sole discretion of the plan administrator.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the deceased designated beneficiary was not the participant's surviving spouse, distribution under this paragraph will be completed by December 31 of the fifth year following the participant's date of death.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the deceased designated beneficiary was the participant's surviving spouse, distribution under this paragraph will be completed by December 31 of the fifth year following the beneficiary's date of death
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For purposes of this Section&nbsp;4.2(a)(5), if a spouse or beneficiary of the participant dies simultaneously with the participant, the participant shall be deemed to be the survivor and to have died subsequent to such spouse or beneficiary.&nbsp;&nbsp;Likewise, if a beneficiary named by a designated beneficiary dies simultaneously with a designated beneficiary, the designated beneficiary shall be deemed to be the survivor and to have died subsequent to the beneficiary named by the designated beneficiary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage76"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If a participant completes or has completed a beneficiary designation form in which the participant designates his spouse as the beneficiary and the participant and such spouse are legally divorced subsequent to the date of such designation; then, the designation shall be administered as if such spouse had predeceased the participant unless the participant, subsequent to the legal divorce, reaffirms the designation by completing a new beneficiary designation form.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(6)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Termination From Service
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If a participant separates from the service of the employer other than by retirement, disability, or death, his vested interest in his accounts shall be equal to the account balance multiplied by the vesting percentage determined below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Profit Sharing Account
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; The vesting percentage applicable to the participant&#x2019;s profit sharing account shall be determined based on his vesting years of service as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Transition Rule
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Notwithstanding the above vesting schedule, the vesting provisions of the plan before
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2002
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, shall continue to apply to participants who do not have an hour of service on or after such date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(C)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Other Accounts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; The participant shall always be 100% vested in his following accounts:&nbsp;&nbsp;employee 401(k) elective deferral account; employee nondeductible contribution account; qualified employer matching contribution account; qualified nonelective contribution account; Roth elective deferral account; rollover/transfer account.&nbsp;&nbsp;The accrued benefit in such accounts shall be nonforfeitable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Forfeitures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Time of Forfeiture
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If a participant terminates employment before his account balances derived from employer contributions are fully vested, the nonvested portion of his accounts shall be forfeited on the earlier of:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The last day of the vesting computation period in which the participant first incurs five consecutive one-year breaks in service, or
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The date the participant receives his entire vested accrued benefit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cashout Distributions and Restoration
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	21
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage77"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cashout Distribution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If an employee terminates service and the value of his vested account balances derived from employer and employee contributions are not greater than $5,000, the employee shall receive a distribution of the value of the entire vested portion of such account balances and the nonvested portion will be treated as a forfeiture.&nbsp;&nbsp;If an employee would have received a distribution under the preceding sentence but for the fact that the employee's vested account balances exceeded $5,000 when the employee terminated service and if at a later time such account balances are reduced such that they are not greater than $5,000, the employee will receive a distribution of such account balance and the nonvested portion will be treated as a forfeiture.&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of this section, if the value of an employee's vested account balances is zero, he shall be deemed to have received a distribution of such vested account balances.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the purpose of determining the value of a participant's vested account balance, prior distributions shall be disregarded if distributions have not commenced under an optional form of payment described in Section&nbsp;4.3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If an employee terminates service and elects, in accordance with the requirements of Section&nbsp;4.3, to receive the value of his vested account balances, the nonvested portion shall be treated as a forfeiture as of the date of distribution.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the employee elects to have distributed less than the entire vested portion of the account balances derived from employer contributions, the part of the nonvested portion that will be treated as a forfeiture is the total nonvested portion multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is the amount of the distribution attributable to employer contributions and the denominator of which is the total value of the vested employer derived account balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restoration of Accounts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If an employee receives a cashout distribution pursuant to this section and resumes employment covered under this plan before he incurs five consecutive one-year breaks in service, his employer-derived account balances shall each be restored to the amount on the date of distribution, if he repays to the plan the full amount of the distribution attributable to employer contributions before the earlier of five years after the first date on which he is subsequently re-employed by the employer, or the date he incurs five consecutive one-year breaks in service following the date of the distribution.&nbsp;&nbsp;If an employee is deemed to receive a distribution pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.2(b)(2), and he resumes employment covered under this plan before he incurs five consecutive one-year breaks in service, upon the re-employment of such employee his employer-derived account balances will be restored to the amount on the date of such deemed distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Any amount required to restore such forfeitures shall be deducted from forfeitures (including forfeitures of excess aggregate contributions) occurring in the plan year of restoration.&nbsp;&nbsp;If forfeitures are insufficient for the restoration, the employer may make a contribution to the plan for such plan year to satisfy the restoration.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, by the end of the plan year following the plan year of restoration, sufficient forfeitures or employer contributions shall be credited to the account to satisfy the restoration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Disposition of Forfeitures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Profit Sharing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Account
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Forfeitures from profit sharing accounts shall be reallocated among the eligible active participants at the end of the plan year in which such forfeitures occur in accordance with the allocation procedures set forth in Section&nbsp;3.2.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employer Matching Contribution Account
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Forfeitures of employer matching contribution accounts first shall be used to reduce administrative expenses; any remaining forfeitures shall be used to reduce the next employer matching contribution to which the employer has commited itself whether for the current plan year or the immediately following plan year.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(d)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Withdrawal of Employee Nondeductible Contributions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; No forfeitures shall occur solely as a result of an employee's withdrawal of employee nondeductible contributions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(e)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Unclaimed Benefits
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Forfeiture
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; The plan does not require the trustee or the plan administrator to search for, or to ascertain the whereabouts of, any participant or beneficiary.&nbsp;&nbsp;At the time the participant's or beneficiary's benefit becomes distributable under the plan, the plan administrator, by certified or registered mail addressed to his last known address of record, shall notify any participant or beneficiary that he is entitled to a distribution under this plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the participant or beneficiary fails to
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	22
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage78"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	claim his distributive share or make his whereabouts known in writing to the plan administrator within twelve months from the date of mailing of the notice, the plan administrator shall treat the participant's or beneficiary's unclaimed payable accrued benefit as forfeited and shall reallocate such forfeiture in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.2(c).&nbsp;&nbsp;A forfeiture under this paragraph shall occur at the end of the notice period or, if later, the earliest date applicable Treasury regulations would permit the forfeiture.&nbsp;&nbsp;These forfeiture provisions apply solely to the participant&#x2019;s or beneficiary&#x2019;s accrued benefit derived from employer contributions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Restoration
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; If a participant or beneficiary who has incurred a forfeiture of his accrued benefit under the provisions of this Section&nbsp;4.2(e) makes a claim, at any time, for his forfeited accrued benefit, the plan administrator shall restore the participant's or beneficiary's forfeited accrued benefit to the same dollar amount as the dollar amount of the accrued benefit forfeited, unadjusted for any gains or losses occurring after the date of the forfeiture.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the plan year in which the participant or beneficiary makes the claim, the plan administrator shall make the restoration from forfeitures occurring in that plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;If forfeitures are insufficient for the restoration, the employer shall make a contribution to the plan to satisfy the restoration.&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan administrator shall direct the trustee to distribute the participant's or beneficiary's restored accrued benefit to him not later than&nbsp;60 days after the close of the plan year in which the plan administrator restores the forfeited accrued benefit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:3PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 11PT">
<A NAME="WMK10K2015EX10-A_HTM__TOC434841013">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Section 4.3 &#x2013; Payment of Participant Accounts
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Time of Payment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Commencement of Benefits
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Unless the participant elects otherwise, distribution of benefits shall begin no later than the 60th&nbsp;day after the latest of the close of the plan year in which:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The participant attains age&nbsp;65 (or normal retirement age, if earlier);
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Occurs the 10th&nbsp;anniversary of the year in which the participant commenced participation in the plan; or
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(C)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The participant terminates service with the employer (i.e. late retirement).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Payment Upon Retirement, Disability, or Death
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Subject to the provisions set forth in Section&nbsp;4.3(a)(1), in the Joint and Survivor Requirements of Section&nbsp;5.2, and in the Distribution Requirements of Section&nbsp;5.3, if the participant terminates employment due to retirement, disability, or death, his account(s) shall be paid as soon as administratively possible after the occurrence of the event creating the right to a distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Payment Upon Other Termination of Employment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Subject to the provisions set forth in Section&nbsp;4.3(a)(1) and in the Distribution Requirements of Section&nbsp;5.3, if the participant terminates employment other than by retirement, disability, or death, his account(s) shall be paid as soon as administratively possible after
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the date of severance of employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Notwithstanding the preceding, an alternate payee may elect to have paid the amount determined under the qualified domestic relations order as soon as administratively possible following the date permitted under Section&nbsp;4.5.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, the failure of a participant (and spouse where the spouse's consent is required) to consent to a distribution while a benefit is immediately distributable, within the meaning of Section&nbsp;5.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, shall be deemed to be an election to defer commencement of payment of any benefit sufficient to satisfy this section.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Form of Payment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; A participant or beneficiary may elect to receive distribution of his account(s) as a lump sum benefit payment.&nbsp;&nbsp;The participant or beneficiary shall file a written request for benefits with the plan administrator before payment will be made.&nbsp;&nbsp;The lump sum benefit payment shall be made in cash from the fund.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the vested accrued benefit is no more than $5,000, benefits shall automatically be paid in a lump sum in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3(d)(5).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Effective solely for distributions made before
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	October&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2009
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, a participant was permitted to elect installment payments over a period of years that meets the Distribution Requirements of Section&nbsp;5.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Installment payments may be made in cash from the fund or by distribution of an annuity term certain contract.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	23
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If a distribution is required under the Distribution Requirements of Section&nbsp;5.3, the participant fails to elect payment, and the vested balance of the account(s) exceeds $5,000, the trustee shall pay the benefit in installment payments that meet the requirements of Section&nbsp;5.3 over the joint life and last survivor expectancy of the participant and his designated beneficiary.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the vested balance of the account(s) does not exceed $5,000, the trustee shall distribute the entire account balance in a lump sum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General Payment Provisions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	All
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	distributions due to be made under this plan shall be made on the basis of the amount to the credit of the participant as of the accounting date coincident with or immediately preceding the occurrence of the event calling for a distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If a distributable event occurs after an allocation date and before allocations have been made to the account of the participant, the distribution shall also include the amounts allocable to the account as of such allocation date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If any person entitled to receive benefits hereunder is physically or mentally incapable of receiving or acknowledging receipt thereof, and if a legal guardian or power of attorney has been appointed for him, the plan administrator may direct the benefit payment to be made to such legal representative.&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan administrator may cause benefits to be paid to any other individual recognized by the state law under which the plan trust has been established.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the event a distribution is to be made to a minor beneficiary, then the plan administrator may direct that such distribution be paid to the legal guardian, or if none, to a parent of such beneficiary or a responsible adult with whom the beneficiary maintains his residence, or to the custodian for such beneficiary under the Uniform Gift to Minors Act or the Gift to Minors Act, if such is permitted by the laws of the state in which said beneficiary resides.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such a payment to the legal guardian, custodian or parent of a minor beneficiary shall fully discharge the trustee, employer, plan administrator, and plan from further liability on account thereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Each optional form of benefit provided under the plan shall be made available to all participants on a nondiscriminatory basis.&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan may not retroactively reduce or eliminate optional forms of benefits and any other Code section&nbsp;411(d)(6) protected benefits, except as provided in Regulation section&nbsp;1.411(d)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#8209;4, Q&amp;A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#8209;2(b) and in other relief granted statutorily or by the Commissioner of Internal Revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The participant's election of a form of benefit payment shall be irrevocable as of the annuity starting date, subject to the notice requirements contained in Section&nbsp;4.3(e)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of accounting, an installment distribution shall be debited from each of a participant's accounts on a pro rata basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(d)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Eligible Rollover Distributions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A distributee may elect, at the time and in the manner prescribed by the plan administrator, to have any portion of an eligible rollover distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee in a direct rollover.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Eligible Rollover Distribution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; An eligible rollover distribution is any distribution of all or any portion of the balance to the credit of the distributee, except that an eligible rollover distribution does not include:&nbsp;&nbsp;any distribution that is one of a series of substantially equal periodic payments (not less frequently than annually) made for the life (or life expectancy) of the distributee or the joint lives (or joint life expectancies) of the distributee and the distributee's designated beneficiary, or for a specified period of ten years or more; any distribution to the extent such distribution is required under Code section&nbsp;401(a)(9) including any portion of such distribution that is not includable in gross income (determined without regard to the exclusion for net unrealized appreciation with respect to employer securities); any hardship withdrawal; any timely withdrawal of an automatic salary reduction contribution made on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2008 from a participant's elective deferral account(s); and any other distribution(s) that is reasonably expected to total less than $200 during a year.&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of the $200 rule, a distribution from a designated Roth account and a distribution from other accounts under the plan are treated as made under separate plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A portion of a distribution shall not fail to be an eligible rollover distribution merely because the portion consists of after-tax employee contributions that are not includable in gross income.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, such portion may be transferred only to:&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) a traditional individual retirement account or annuity described in Code section&nbsp;408(a) or&nbsp;(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(traditional IRA) or, effective for distributions on or after
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>

</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2008, a Roth individual retirement account or annuity described in Code section&nbsp;408A (Roth IRA); or (B)&nbsp;a qualified plan or an annuity contract described in Code section&nbsp;401(a) and 403(b), respectively, that agrees to separately account for amounts so transferred (and earnings thereon), including separately accounting for the portion of such distribution that is includible in gross income and the portion of such distribution that is not so includible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Eligible Retirement Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	An eligible retirement plan is a traditional IRA, a Roth IRA (effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2008), an annuity plan described in Code section&nbsp;403(a), an annuity contract described in Code section&nbsp;403(b), a qualified plan described in Code section&nbsp;401(a), that accepts the distributee's eligible rollover distribution,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or an eligible plan under Code section&nbsp;457(b) that is maintained by a state, political subdivision of a state, or any agency or instrumentality of a state or political subdivision of a state and that agrees to separately account for amounts transferred into such plan from this plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;The definition of eligible retirement plan shall also apply in the case of a distribution to a surviving spouse, or to a spouse or former spouse who is the alternate payee under a qualified domestic relations order, as defined in Code section&nbsp;414(p).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If any portion of an eligible rollover distribution is attributable to payments or distributions from a designated Roth account, an eligible retirement plan with respect to such portion shall include only a designated Roth account or a Roth IRA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Distributee
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; A distributee includes an employee or former employee.&nbsp;&nbsp;The employee's or former employee's surviving spouse and the employee's or former employee's spouse or former spouse who is the alternate payee under a qualified domestic relations order, as defined in Code section&nbsp;414(p), are distributees with regard to the interest of the spouse or former spouse.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For distributions after December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2006, a distributee shall include a nonspouse beneficiary but only with respect to a direct transfer to an inherited traditional or Roth IRA established on his behalf for the purpose of receiving the distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Direct Rollover
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; A direct rollover is a payment by the plan to the eligible retirement plan specified by the distributee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(5)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Automatic Rollovers
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; In the event of a mandatory distribution greater than&nbsp;$1,000 in accordance with the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.2(b)(2)(A), if the participant does not elect to have such distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the participant in a direct rollover or to receive the distribution directly in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3(e), then the plan administrator shall pay the distribution in a direct rollover to an individual retirement plan designated by the plan administrator.&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of determining whether a mandatory distribution is greater than&nbsp;$1,000, the portion of the participant&#x2019;s distribution attributable to any rollover contribution shall be included.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(e)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Payment Election Procedures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As described in Section&nbsp;5.2(a), an account balance in excess of $5,000 shall not be immediately distributed without the consent of the participant.&nbsp;&nbsp;The participant shall receive the notice required under Regulation section&nbsp;1.411(a)-11(c) no less than 30&nbsp;days and no more than 180&nbsp;days before the annuity starting date with respect to the distribution.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The written explanation shall include a description of the consequences of failing to defer receipt of the distribution.&nbsp;&nbsp;F
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	or any distribution in excess of $200, the plan administrator shall give the participant notice of his eligible rollover distribution rights.&nbsp;&nbsp;The participant shall receive such notice in the same time period as the 411&nbsp;notice is required to be provided.&nbsp;&nbsp;If a distribution is one to which Code sections&nbsp;401(a)(11) and&nbsp;417 do not apply, such distribution may commence less than 30&nbsp;days after the 411&nbsp;notice is given, provided that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The plan administrator clearly informs the participant that the participant has a right to a period of at least 30&nbsp;days after receiving the notice to consider the decision of whether or not to elect a distribution (and, if applicable, a particular distribution option), and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The participant, after receiving the notice, affirmatively elects a distribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the event of a mandatory distribution greater than&nbsp;$1,000 in accordance with the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.2(b)(2)(A), if the participant does not elect to have such distribution paid directly to an eligible retirement plan specified by the participant in a direct rollover or to receive the distribution directly in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.3(d), then the plan administrator will pay the distribution in a direct rollover to an individual retirement plan designated by the plan administrator.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12

	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries

<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
