</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Catch-up contributions means elective deferrals made to the plan that are in excess of an otherwise applicable plan limit and that are made by participants who are age&nbsp;50 or over by the end of their taxable years.&nbsp;&nbsp;An otherwise applicable plan limit is a limit in the plan that applies to elective deferrals without regard to catch-up contributions, such as any limitation set forth in Section&nbsp;3.4, the limits on annual additions described in Section&nbsp;5.1, the dollar limitation on elective deferrals under Code section&nbsp;402(g) (not taking into account catch-up contributions) and the limit imposed by the actual deferral percentage (ADP) test under Section&nbsp;5.5(b).&nbsp;&nbsp;Catch-up contributions for a participant for a taxable year may not exceed:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the dollar limit on catch-up contributions under Code section&nbsp;414(v)(2)(B)(i) for the taxable year; or
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	when added to other elective deferrals, 100% of the participant&#x2019;s compensation for the taxable year (subject to the reservation of sufficient compensation to satisfy federal, state, and local income and other wage-related tax requirements).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The dollar limit on catch-up contributions was $5,000 for taxable years beginning in 2006.&nbsp;&nbsp;After 2006, the $5,000 limitation is adjusted by the Secretary of the Treasury for cost-of-living increases under Code section&nbsp;414(v)(2)(C).&nbsp;&nbsp;Any such adjustments will be in multiples of $500.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Catch-up contributions shall not be:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	subject to the limits on annual additions;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	taken into account under the ADP test; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(C)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	taken into account in determining the minimum allocation under Section&nbsp;5.4(b); however, catch-up contributions made in prior years shall be taken into account in determining whether the plan is top-heavy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Provisions in the plan relating to catch-up contributions apply to elective deferrals made after December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2001.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	D
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	istribution of Excess Elective Deferrals
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A participant may assign to this plan any excess elective deferrals made during a taxable year of the participant by following the claim procedure set forth in Section&nbsp;5.5(a)(4).&nbsp;&nbsp;Also, the employer may notify this plan on behalf of a participant who has excess deferrals for the taxable year calculated by taking into account only elective deferrals under the plans, contracts or arrangements maintained by the employer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Notwithstanding any other provision of the plan, excess elective deferrals, plus any income and minus any loss allocable thereto, shall be distributed no later than April&nbsp;15 to any participant to whose account excess elective deferrals were assigned for the preceding year and for whom excess elective deferrals have been claimed for such taxable year or calendar year.&nbsp;&nbsp;For participant taxable years beginning after December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2005, distribution of excess elective deferrals for a year shall be made first from the participant's Roth elective deferral account, to the extent Roth elective deferrals were made for the year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess elective deferrals shall only be distributed from the 401(k) elective deferral account after the Roth elective deferrals made for the year have been fully distributed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Claims
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The participant's claim shall be submitted in writing to the plan administrator no later than March&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;The participant shall specify the excess deferral amount for the preceding calendar year and shall provide a written statement that if such amounts are not distributed, such excess deferral amount, when added to amounts deferred under other plans or arrangements described in Code sections&nbsp;401(k), 408(k), 457,&nbsp;or 403(b), exceeds the limit imposed on the participant by Code section&nbsp;402(g) for the year in which the deferral occurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(5)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Definitions (Code Section 402(g) Limitations)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Elective Deferrals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean any employer contributions made to the plan at the election of the participant, in lieu of cash compensation, and shall include contributions made pursuant to a salary reduction agreement or other deferral mechanism.&nbsp;&nbsp;With respect to any taxable year, a participant's elective deferral is the sum of all employer contributions made on behalf of such participant pursuant to an election to defer under any qualified cash or deferred arrangement as
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries

<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	40

</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	described in Code section&nbsp;401(k), any salary reduction simplified employee pension described in section&nbsp;408(k)(6), any SIMPLE IRA plan described in section&nbsp;408(p), any plan described under section&nbsp;501(c)(18), and any employer contributions made on the behalf of a participant for the purchase of an annuity contract under section&nbsp;403(b) pursuant to a salary reduction agreement.&nbsp;&nbsp;For years beginning after December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2005, the term
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	elective deferrals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall include pre-tax elective deferrals and Roth elective deferrals.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pre-tax elective deferrals means a participant's elective deferrals that are not includable in the participant's gross income at the time deferred.&nbsp;&nbsp;Elective deferrals shall not include any deferrals properly distributed as excess annual additions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Roth Elective Deferrals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean a participant's elective deferrals that are includable in the participant's gross income at the time deferred and have been irrevocably designated as Roth elective deferrals by the participant in the deferral election in lieu of all or a portion of the pre-tax elective deferrals the participant is otherwise eligible to make under the plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;A participant's Roth elective deferrals shall be maintained in a separate account containing only the participant's Roth elective deferrals and gains and losses attributable to those Roth elective deferrals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(C)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Excess Elective Deferrals
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean those elective deferrals that either:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;are made during the participant's taxable year and exceed the dollar limitation under Section&nbsp;5.5(a) (including, if applicable, the dollar limitation on catch-up contributions described in Section&nbsp;5.5(a)(2)) for such year; or (ii)&nbsp;are made during a calendar year and exceed such dollar limitations for the participant's taxable year beginning in such calendar year, counting only elective deferrals made under this plan and any other plan, contract or arrangement maintained by the employer.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess elective deferrals shall be treated as annual additions under the plan, unless such amounts are distributed no later than the first April&nbsp;15 following the close of the participant's taxable year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(6)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Determination of Income or Loss
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Excess elective deferrals shall be adjusted for any income or loss.&nbsp;&nbsp;For taxable years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2008, the income or loss allocable to excess elective deferrals allocated to each participant is the income or loss allocable to the participant's elective deferral account for the taxable year multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is such participant's excess elective deferrals for the year and the denominator is the participant's account balance attributable to elective deferrals without regard to any income or loss occurring during such taxable year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective solely for the taxable year beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, and to the extent the excess elective deferrals were credited with gain or loss as of an accounting date within the gap period (i.e., the period after the close of the taxable year and prior to the distribution), allocable income or loss also includes 10% of the amount determined under the preceding sentence multiplied by the number of whole calendar months between the end of the participant&#x2019;s taxable year and the date of distribution, counting the month of distribution if distribution occurred after the 15th of such month.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:6PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Actual Deferral Percentage Test
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The actual deferral percentage (hereinafter
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ADP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) for a plan year for participants who are highly compensated employees for the plan year and the prior year's ADP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year must satisfy one of the following tests:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;The ADP for a plan year for participants who are highly compensated employees for the plan year shall not exceed the prior year's ADP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year multiplied by&nbsp;1.25; or (ii)&nbsp;The ADP for a plan year for participants who are highly compensated employees for the plan year shall not exceed the prior year's ADP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year multiplied by&nbsp;2.0, provided that the ADP for participants who are highly compensated employees does not exceed the ADP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees in the prior plan year by more than two percentage points.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In place of the prior year testing method described above, if so elected by the employer and adopted in Section&nbsp;3.4(a), the ADP tests in (i) and (ii) will be applied by comparing the current plan year's ADP for participants who are highly compensated employees with the current plan year's ADP for participants who are nonhighly compensated employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the alternative, the plan may satisfy the ADP test requirements by meeting the ADP test safe harbor requirements as described in Section&nbsp;5.5(f).&nbsp;&nbsp;Election of this method shall be treated as an election to use the current year testing method.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once the current year testing method election has been made, the employer can elect prior year testing for a plan year only if the plan has used current year testing for each of the preceding
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">

	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12

	by

	41

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5&nbsp;plan years (or if lesser, the number of plan years the plan has been in existence) or if, as a result of a merger or acquisition described in Code section&nbsp;410(b)(6)(c)(i), the employer maintains both a plan using prior year testing and a plan using current year testing and the change is made within the transition period described in section&nbsp;410(b)(6)(c)(ii).&nbsp;&nbsp;Such elections shall be reflected in Section&nbsp;3.4(a).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Special Rules Applying to ADP Test
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A participant is a highly compensated employee for a particular plan year if he meets the definition of a highly compensated employee in effect for that plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;A participant is a nonhighly compensated employee for a particular plan year if he does not meet the definition of a highly compensated employee in effect for that plan year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The ADP for any participant who is a highly compensated employee for the plan year and who is eligible to have elective deferrals (and qualified nonelective contributions or qualified matching contributions, or both, to the extent treated as elective deferrals for purposes of the ADP test) allocated to his accounts under two or more arrangements described in Code section&nbsp;401(k), that are maintained by the employer, shall be determined as if such elective deferrals (and, to the extent taken into account, such qualified nonelective contributions or qualified matching contributions, or both) were made under a single arrangement.&nbsp;&nbsp;If a highly compensated employee participates in two or more cash or deferred arrangements of the employer that have different plan years, all elective deferrals made during this plan's plan year under all such arrangements shall be aggregated.&nbsp;&nbsp;For plan years beginning before January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006, all elective deferrals made under all such cash or deferred arrangements ending with or within the same calendar year shall be treated as a single arrangement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, certain plans shall be treated as separate if mandatorily disaggregated under regulations under Code section&nbsp;401(k).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the event that this plan satisfies the requirements of Code sections&nbsp;401(k), 401(a)(4), or&nbsp;410(b) only if aggregated with one or more other plans, or if one or more other plans satisfy the requirements of such Code sections only if aggregated with this plan, then this Section&nbsp;5.5(b)(1) shall be applied by determining the ADP of employees as if all such plans were a single plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;If more than 10% of the employer's nonhighly compensated employees are involved in a plan coverage change as defined in Regulation section&nbsp;1.401(k)-2(c)(4), then any adjustments to the nonhighly compensated employees' ADP for the prior year shall be made in accordance with such regulation, unless the employer has elected in Section&nbsp;3.4(a) to use the current year testing method.&nbsp;&nbsp;Plans may be aggregated in order to satisfy Code section&nbsp;401(k) only if they have the same plan year and use the same ADP testing method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If:&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;this plan is not a successor plan (as defined in Regulation section&nbsp;1.401(k)-2(c)(2)(iii)), and (B)&nbsp;this plan is not aggregated under Regulation section&nbsp;1.401(k)-1(b)(4) for such plan year with any other plan that was or that included a Code section&nbsp;401(k) plan in the prior year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	; then,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in the case of the first plan year the plan permits any participant to make elective deferrals the amount treated as the ADP for participants who are nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year shall be 3% or, if the employer so elects, the ADP for participants who are nonhighly compensated employees as calculated for such first plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such election shall be set forth in Section&nbsp;3.4(a).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For purposes of determining the ADP test, elective deferrals, qualified nonelective contributions and qualified matching contributions must be made before the last day of the twelve-month period immediately following the plan year to which the contributions relate.&nbsp;&nbsp;An elective deferral shall be taken into account only if it relates to compensation that either (a)&nbsp;would have been received by the participant in the plan year but for the deferral election, or (b)&nbsp;is attributable to services performed by the participant in the plan year and would have been received by the participant within 2&#xBD;&nbsp;months after the last day of the plan year but for the deferral election.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	When the prior year testing method is used, qualified nonelective contributions and qualified matching contributions shall not be taken into account.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(vi)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The plan administrator shall maintain records sufficient to demonstrate satisfaction of the ADP test and the amount of qualified nonelective contributions or qualified matching contributions, or both, used in such test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(vii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	When the current year testing method is used, qualified nonelective contributions may be taken into account as elective deferrals only to the extent needed to meet the ADP test.&nbsp;&nbsp;Further, qualified matching contributions may be taken into account only to the extent such contributions are not needed to meet the average deferral percentage test unless it is the intention of the plan administrator to test all qualified nonelective and matching contributions under the ADP test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;TEXT-INDENT: -22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(viii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Effective for plan years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006, qualified nonelective contributions cannot be taken into account for a plan year for a nonhighly compensated employee to the extent such contributions exceed the product of that nonhighly compensated employee's compensation and the greater of 5% or two times the plan's representative contribution rate.&nbsp;&nbsp;For this purpose, the plan's representative contribution rate is the lowest applicable contribution rate of any eligible nonhighly compensated employee among a group of eligible nonhighly compensated employees that consists of half of all eligible nonhighly compensated employees for the plan year (or, if greater, the lowest applicable contribution rate of any eligible nonhighly compensated employee in the group of all eligible nonhighly compensated employees for the plan year and who is employed by the employer on the last day of the plan year).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The applicable contribution rate for an eligible nonhighly compensated employee is the sum of his qualified matching contributions taken into account under the ADP test and his qualified nonelective contributions for the plan year, divided by his compensation for the same period.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the preceding, qualified nonelective contributions that are made in connection with an employer's obligation to pay prevailing wages under the Davis-Bacon Act can be taken into account for a plan year for a nonhighly compensated employee to the extent such contributions do not exceed 10% of his compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ix)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Applicable limitations when testing changes from current year testing to prior year testing:&nbsp;&nbsp;The ADP for the prior plan year shall be determined taking into account only:&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;elective contributions for nonhighly compensated employees that were taken into account for purposes of the ADP test in the prior plan year under the current plan year testing method and (B)&nbsp;qualified nonelective contributions not previously taken into account under either the ADP or ACP test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(x)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The determination and treatment of the ADP amounts of any participant shall satisfy such other requirements as may be prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Actual Deferral Percentage
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ADP) shall mean, for a specified group of participants (either highly compensated employees or nonhighly compensated employees) for a plan year, the average of the ratios (calculated separately for each participant in such group) of (1)&nbsp;the amount of employer contributions actually paid over to the trust on behalf of such participant for the plan year to (2)&nbsp;the participant's compensation as defined in Section&nbsp;1.2(e).&nbsp;&nbsp;The actual deferral ratio of each participant and the actual deferral percentage of each group shall be calculated to the nearest hundredth of a percentage point.&nbsp;&nbsp;Employer contributions on behalf of any participant shall include: (1)&nbsp;any elective deferrals (other than catch-up contributions) made pursuant to the participant's deferral election, including excess elective deferrals of highly compensated employees, but excluding (a)&nbsp;excess elective deferrals of nonhighly compensated employees that arise solely from elective deferrals to the extent the excess deferrals are prohibited under Code section&nbsp;401(a)(30) due to the contributions made under this plan and without taking into account deferrals made under an unrelated employer's plan and (b)&nbsp;elective deferrals that are taken into account in the actual contribution percentage test (provided the ADP test is satisfied both with and without exclusion of these elective deferrals); and (2)&nbsp;at the election of the employer, qualified nonelective contributions and qualified matching contributions.&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of computing actual deferral percentages, an employee who would be a participant but for the failure to make elective deferrals shall be treated as a participant on whose behalf no elective deferrals are made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Distribution of Excess Contributions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12

	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	43

</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Notwithstanding any other provision of this plan, excess contributions, plus any income and minus any loss allocable thereto, shall be distributed no later than the last day of each plan year to participants to whose accounts such excess contributions were allocated for the preceding plan year, except to the extent such excess contributions are classified as catch-up contributions.&nbsp;&nbsp;If such excess amounts (other than catch-up contributions) are distributed more than 2&#xBD;&nbsp;months after the last day of the plan year in which such excess amounts arose, a 10% excise tax will be imposed on the employer maintaining the plan with respect to such amounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the preceding, the excise tax will not be imposed if the distribution is made within 6&nbsp;months after the last day of such plan year if the plan is an eligible automatic contribution arrangement within the meaning of Code section&nbsp;414(w) that covers all eligible nonhighly compensated employees and highly compensated employees for the entire portion of the plan year for which they are eligible and provides the notice described in Section&nbsp;5.5(f)(4) even after an affirmative deferral election has been made.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess contributions shall be allocated to the highly compensated employees with the largest amounts of contributions taken into account in calculating the ADP test for the plan year in which the excess arose, beginning with the highly compensated employee with the largest amount of such contributions and continuing in descending order until all of the excess contributions have been allocated.&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent a highly compensated employee has not reached his catch-up contribution limit under the plan, excess contributions allocated to such highly compensated employee shall be recognized as catch-up contributions and will not be treated as excess contributions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Excess contributions shall be treated as annual additions under the plan even if distributed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Determination of Income or Loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Excess contributions shall be adjusted for any income or loss.&nbsp;&nbsp;For plan years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2008, the income or loss allocable to excess contributions allocated to each participant is the income or loss allocable to the participant's elective deferral account(s) (and, if applicable, the qualified nonelective contribution account or the qualified employer matching contribution account or both) for the plan year multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is such participant's excess contributions for the year and the denominator is the participant's account balance(s) attributable to elective deferrals (and qualified nonelective contributions or qualified matching contributions, or both, if any of such contributions are included in the ADP test) without regard to any income or loss occurring during such plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective solely for the plan year beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006 and the plan year beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007 and to the extent the excess contributions were credited with gain or loss as of an accounting date within the gap period (i.e., the period after the close of the plan year and prior to the distribution), allocable income or loss also includes 10% of the amount determined under the preceding sentence multiplied by the number of whole calendar months between the end of the plan year and the date of distribution, counting the month of distribution if distribution occured after the 15th of such month.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Accounting for Excess Contributions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Excess contributions allocated to a participant shall be distributed from the participant's elective deferral account(s) and qualified employer matching contribution account (if applicable) in proportion to the participant's elective deferrals and qualified matching contributions (to the extent used in the ADP test) for the plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess contributions shall be distributed from the participant's qualified nonelective contribution account only to the extent that such excess contributions exceed the amount of excess contributions in the participant's elective deferral account(s) and qualified matching contribution account.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For plan years beginning after December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2005, distribution of excess contributions for a year shall be made first from the participant's Roth elective deferral account, to the extent Roth elective deferrals were made for the year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess elective deferrals shall only be distributed from the 401(k) elective deferral account after the Roth elective deferrals made for the year have been fully distributed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(C)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Excess Contributions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean, with respect to any plan year, the excess of:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;The aggregate amount of employer contributions actually taken into account in computing the ADP of highly compensated employees for such plan year, over (ii)&nbsp;The maximum amount of such contributions permitted by the ADP test (determined by hypothetically reducing contributions made on behalf of highly compensated employees in order of the ADPs, beginning with the highest of such percentages).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Such determination shall be made after first determining excess elective deferrals pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.5(a).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>

</FONT>

	W969
</FONT>

	Actuaries
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	44
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT -6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:6PT;PADDING:0PT 27PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:8PT;PADDING:0PT 27PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Limitations on Employee and Matching Contributions Under Code Section&nbsp;401(m)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The actual contribution percentage (hereinafter
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ACP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	) for a plan year for participants who are highly compensated employees for the plan year and the prior year's ACP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year must satisfy one of the following tests:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;The ACP for a plan year for participants who are highly compensated employees for the plan year shall not exceed the prior year's ACP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year multiplied by&nbsp;1.25; or (ii)&nbsp;The ACP for a plan year for participants who are highly compensated employees for the plan year shall not exceed the prior year's ACP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year multiplied by 2.0, provided that the ACP for participants who are highly compensated employees does not exceed the ACP for participants who were nonhighly compensated employees in the prior plan year by more than two &nbsp;percentage points.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In place of the prior year testing method described above, if so elected by the employer and adopted in Section&nbsp;3.6, the ACP tests in&nbsp;(i) and&nbsp;(ii) will be applied by comparing the current plan year's ACP for participants who are highly compensated employees with the current plan year's ACP for participants who are nonhighly compensated employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the alternative, the plan may satisfy the ACP test requirements by meeting the safe harbor requirements of Section&nbsp;5.5(f)(3) and&nbsp;(4).&nbsp;&nbsp;Election of this method shall be treated as an election to use the current year testing method.&nbsp;&nbsp;In such a plan year, the current year testing method shall be used for the purpose of testing any employee nondeductible contributions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once the current year testing method election has been made, the employer can elect prior year testing for a plan year only if the plan has used current year testing for each of the preceding 5&nbsp;plan years (or if lesser, the number of plan years the plan has been in existence) or if, as a result of a merger or acquisition described in Code section&nbsp;410(b)(6)(c)(i), the employer maintains both a plan using prior year testing and a plan using current year testing and the change is made within the transition period described in section&nbsp;410(b)(6)(c)(ii).&nbsp;&nbsp;Such elections shall be reflected in Section&nbsp;3.6.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Special Rules for Limitations Under Code Section 401(m)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	A participant is a highly compensated employee for a particular plan year if he meets the definition of a highly compensated employee in effect for that plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;A participant is a nonhighly compensated employee for a particular plan year if he does not meet the definition of a highly compensated employee in effect for that plan year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For purposes of this Section&nbsp;5.5(c)(1), the contribution percentage for any participant who is a highly compensated employee and who is eligible to have contribution percentage amounts allocated to his account under two or more plans described in Code section&nbsp;401(a), or arrangements described in Code section&nbsp;401(k) that are maintained by the employer, shall be determined as if the total of such contribution percentage amounts were made under each plan and arrangement.&nbsp;&nbsp;If a highly compensated employee participates in two or more such plans or cash or deferred arrangements that have different plan years, all contribution percentage amounts made during the plan year for this plan under all such plans and arrangements shall be aggregated.&nbsp;&nbsp;For plan years beginning before January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006, all such plans and cash or deferred arrangements ending with or within the same calendar year shall be treated as a single arrangement.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, certain plans shall be treated as separate if mandatorily disaggregated under regulations under Code section&nbsp;401(m).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the event that this plan satisfies the requirements of Code sections&nbsp;401(m), 401(a)(4) or&nbsp;410(b) only if aggregated with one or more other plans, or if one or more other plans satisfy the requirements of such sections only if aggregated with this plan, then this Section&nbsp;5.5(c)(1) shall be applied by determining the ACP of employees as if all such plans were a single plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;If more than 10% of the employer's nonhighly compensated employees are involved in a plan coverage change as defined in Regulation section&nbsp;1.401(m)-2(c)(4), then any adjustments to the nonhighly compensated employees' ACP for the prior year shall be made in accordance with such regulation, unless the employer has elected in Section&nbsp;3.6 to use the current year testing method.&nbsp;&nbsp;Plans may be aggregated in order to satisfy Code section&nbsp;401(m) only if they have the same plan year and use the same ACP testing method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>

	by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conrad&nbsp;Siegel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Actuaries
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:4PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	45

</P>
</DIV>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	If:&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;this plan is not a successor plan (as defined in Regulation section&nbsp;1.401(m)-2(c)(2)(iii)) and (B)&nbsp;this plan is not aggregated under Regulation section&nbsp;1.401(m)-1(b)(4) for such plan year with any other plan that was or that included a Code section&nbsp;401(m) plan in the prior year; then, in the case of the first plan year this plan permits any participant to make employee contributions, provides for matching contributions, or both, the amount treated as the ACP for participants who are nonhighly compensated employees for the prior plan year shall be 3% or, if the employer so elects, the ACP for participants who are nonhighly compensated employees as calculated for such first plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such election shall be set forth in Section&nbsp;3.6.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	For purposes of determining the ACP test, employee contributions are considered to have been made in the plan year in which contributed to the trust.&nbsp;&nbsp;Matching contributions and qualified nonelective contributions will be considered made for a plan year if made no later than the end of the twelve-month period beginning on the day after the close of the plan year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	When the prior year testing method is used, qualified nonelective contributions shall not be taken into account.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(vi)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The plan administrator shall maintain records sufficient to demonstrate satisfaction of the ACP test and the amount of qualified nonelective contributions or qualified matching contributions, or both, used in such test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;TEXT-INDENT: -22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(vii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Elective deferral contributions may be taken into account; however, the ADP test shall be met before any elective deferrals are used in the ACP test and the elective deferrals needed to meet the ADP test shall not be used to meet the ACP test.&nbsp;&nbsp;When the current year testing method is used, qualified nonelective contributions shall be taken into account to the extent such contributions are not used to meet the ADP test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;TEXT-INDENT: -22.5PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(viii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Effective for plan years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006, a matching contribution with respect to an elective deferral for a nonhighly compensated employee shall not be taken into account under the ACP test to the extent it exceeds the greatest of:&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;5% of compensation; (B)&nbsp;the employee's elective deferrals for a year; and (C)&nbsp;the product of 2 times the plan's representative matching rate and the employee's elective deferrals for a year.&nbsp;&nbsp;For this purpose, the plan's representative matching rate is the lowest matching rate for any eligible nonhighly compensated employee among a group of nonhighly compensated employees that consists of half of all eligible nonhighly compensated employees in the plan for the plan year who make elective deferrals for the plan year (or, if greater, the lowest matching rate for all eligible nonhighly compensated employees in the plan who are employed by the employer on the last day of the plan year and who make elective deferrals for the plan year).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The matching rate for an employee generally is the matching contributions made for such employee divided by his elective deferrals (and employee nondeductible contributions) for the year.&nbsp;&nbsp;If the matching rate is not the same for all levels of his elective deferrals (and employee nondeductible contributions), the employee's matching rate is determined assuming that his elective deferrals are equal to 6% of compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ix)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Applicable limitations when testing changes from current year testing to prior year testing:&nbsp;&nbsp;The ACP for the prior plan year shall be determined taking into account only:&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;employee contributions for nonhighly compensated employees made for the prior plan year, (B)&nbsp;matching contributions for nonhighly compensated employees that were taken into account for purposes of the ACP test in the prior plan year under the current plan year testing method, and (C)&nbsp;qualified nonelective contributions not previously taken into account under either the ADP or ACP test.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(x)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The determination and treatment of the ACP amounts of any participant shall satisfy such other requirements as may be prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(B)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Definitions (Code Section 401(m) Limitations)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Actual Contribution Percentage
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ACP) shall mean, for a specified group of participants (either highly compensated employees or nonhighly compensated employees) for a plan year, the average of the contribution percentages of the eligible participants in the group.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT -27.35PT 9PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT SOLID #000000 ;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 16PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Weis Markets, Inc. Retirement Savings Plan
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contribution Percentage
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean the ratio (expressed as a percentage calculated to the nearest hundredth of a percentage point) of the participant's contribution percentage amounts to the participant's compensation as defined in Section&nbsp;1.2(e).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contribution Percentage Amounts
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean the sum of the employee nondeductible contributions, employer matching contributions and elective deferrals (to the extent not taken into account for purposes of the ADP test) made under the plan on behalf of the participant for the plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such contribution percentage amounts shall not include matching contributions that are forfeited either to correct excess aggregate contributions or because the contributions to which they relate are excess deferrals, excess contributions, or excess aggregate contributions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Qualified nonelective contributions may be included in the contribution percentage amounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;Elective deferrals may also be used in calculating the contribution percentage amounts so long as the ADP test is met before the elective deferrals are used in the ACP test and the ADP test continues to be met following the exclusion of those elective deferrals that are used to meet the ACP test.&nbsp;&nbsp;The contribution percentage amounts shall be calculated to the nearest hundredth of a percentage point.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Eligible Participant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean any employee who is eligible to make an employee nondeductible contribution, or an elective deferral (if the employer takes such contributions into account in the calculation of the contribution percentage), or to receive an employer matching contribution (including forfeitures).&nbsp;&nbsp;If an employee nondeductible contribution is required as a condition of participation in the plan, any employee who would be a participant in the plan if such employee made such a contribution shall be treated as an eligible participant on behalf of whom no employee contributions are made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employee Nondeductible Contribution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(or employee contribution) shall mean any contribution (other than Roth elective deferrals) made under Section&nbsp;3.5 to the plan by or on behalf of a participant that is included in the participant's gross income in the year in which made and that is maintained under a separate account to which earnings and losses are allocated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 90PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(vi)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Matching Contribution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shall mean an employer contribution made to this or any other defined contribution plan on behalf of a participant on account of an employee nondeductible contribution made by such participant, or on account of a participant's elective deferral, under a plan maintained by the employer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Distribution of Excess Aggregate Contributions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 54PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Notwithstanding any other provision of this plan, excess aggregate contributions, plus any income and minus any loss allocable thereto, shall be forfeited, if forfeitable, or if not forfeitable, distributed no later than the last day of each plan year to participants to whose accounts such excess aggregate contributions were allocated for the preceding plan year.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess aggregate contributions shall be allocated to the highly compensated employees with the largest contribution dollar amounts taken into account in calculating the ACP test for the plan year in which the excess arose, beginning with the highly compensated employee with the largest dollar amount of such contributions and continuing in descending order until all of the excess aggregate contributions have been allocated.&nbsp;&nbsp;If such excess aggregate contributions are distributed more than 2&#xBD;&nbsp;months after the last day of the plan year in which such excess amounts arose, a 10% excise tax will be imposed on the employer maintaining the plan with respect to those amounts.&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the preceding, the excise tax will not be imposed if the distribution is made within 6&nbsp;months after the last day of such plan year if the plan is an eligible automatic contribution arrangement within the meaning of Code section&nbsp;414(w) that covers all eligible nonhighly compensated employees and highly compensated employees for the entire portion of the plan year for which they are eligible and provides the notice described in Section&nbsp;5.5(f)(4) even after an affirmative deferral election has been made.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excess aggregate contributions shall be treated as annual additions under the plan even if distributed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT 72PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-INDENT:-18PT;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Determination of Income or Loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&#x2013; Excess aggregate contributions shall be adjusted for any income or loss.&nbsp;&nbsp;For plan years beginning on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2008, the income or loss allocable to excess aggregate contributions allocated to each participant is the income or loss allocable to the participant's employee nondeductible contribution account, employer matching contribution account (if any, and if all amounts therein are not used in the ADP test) and, if applicable, qualified nonelective contribution account and elective deferral account(s) for the plan
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT SOLID #000000 ;PUNCTUATION-WRAP:HANGING;VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:236PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	_
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	W969
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:6PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT; PADDING-RIGHT:187PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Copyright &#xA9; 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
